content: I've replaced the tag "Markov Chain" with "Markov chains" to standardise the tags.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: The description is clear and the tests were helpful. I imagine some people will find this a bit tough if they don't know where to start, but once that is sorted it is pretty straightforward.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: I solved https://www.codingame.com/ide/puzzle/dice-probability-calculator not long ago and it was a nice application (for the beginning at least)

I think I will use this program the next time I play Risk with my children :-)

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: I tried it and i liked it :)
Done with some memoïzation and recursion.

Details :
The description is clear enough to work without questions on the rules
Brute force give timeout
No need of weird probability law to complete :)
Fun to compare results on a grid at the end and see the repartition with few dices are many dices on probabilities :D

Goal section
* Please state how the number of dice that can be rolled changes with the army size. If you do it in a table format, you would probably want to format it using the
```multi-line
monospace
syntax```.

* Suggest to add "the attacker" in front of "winning the game" in the last sentence.

Output section
* Please change "the closest second decimal" to "the nearest 0.01%".

Thanks.

Thanks for your comments. the multi-line monospace syntax is a great idea.
-- Challenge updated --
